text: Dillon is a city in and the county seat of Beaverhead County, Montana, United States. The population was 3,880 at the 2020 census. The city was named for Union Pacific Railroad President Sidney Dillon. It was founded in 1880 as a railroad town. The Beaverhead River flows through the town. == References == Category:1880s establishments in Montana Territory Category:1880 establishments in the United States Category:Cities in Montana Category:County seats in Montana
title: Dillon, Montana
